basics.name: Peng Qin
basics.Title: Dr.
basics.summary: Peng Qin is a highly motivated researcher with a PhD in Building Physics and extensive expertise in computational fluid dynamics (CFD), urban ventilation, indoor and outdoor air quality, particle/gas dispersion modelling, and vehicle emissions modelling. His research spans from outdoor urban climate challenges to indoor air quality — from pollutant dispersion and thermal studies in urban areas to COVID-related indoor ventilation and aerosol dispersion studies. He is adept at large-scale numerical modelling in UNIX/Linux environments using ANSYS Fluent/OpenFOAM. He is passionate about addressing environmental health issues (e.g. contaminant exposure due to limited ventilation, urban overheating, and indoor/outdoor air quality) and supporting government and stakeholder policy and decision-making.

projects.name: MItigation STrategies (MIST) for Airborne Infection Control
projects.summary: The MIST project focuses on identifying, developing, and promoting effective and evidence-based strategies to reduce the risk of airborne transmission of viruses in shared indoor spaces.

projects.name: Urban Heat, Air Quality and Vehicle Emission Studies
projects.summary: The goal of this project is to evaluate source modeling techniques to enhance the pollutant assessment in street canyons and provide recommendations for both the scientific community and practitioners in improving urban air quality.

projects.name: Program for Pandemic Preparedness by Ventilation (P3Venti)
projects.summary: The P3Venti project leads, collects and distributes scientific research on the influence and potential impact of ventilation on aerogenic pathogen spread, exposure risk and infection control.

projects.name: Clean Air for Everyone (CLAIRE) Project
projects.summary: The CLAIRE project aims at exploring the potential of mechanical ventilation and air cleaning technologies to limit the adverse impacts of pandemics on health and well-being, with a primary focuses areas of primary schools and nursing homes.
